segments.text: Matt , I'm going to ask you some questions about pet.First question , do you have a pet ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yes , in fact , my mom's house we have three , three pets . two dogs and a cat . My family actually raises dogs for helping blind people .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Wow , like how do they train the dogs ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: How do they train the dogs ? Well , I mean , it's a long process , right ... we get them when they're puppies ... and so we train them basic ... you know , sit , come ... really basic things ... then , after they're about two year old , they go a different training school .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Well , how many dogs do they train at a time ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Oh , just one ! We have our own dog , and then we have a dog that we have that we are training .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Do you ever see the dogs you trained , like out on the street , or anything ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Sometimes we'll see them , they'll have like sort of conventions of reunions of the pets so , yeah , you get to see them once in awhile .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Oh , wow , that's cool . Um , why do people keep pets ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I guess the most important thing is companionship , right ! So there is always somebody there for you that will like you no matter what .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yeah , that's true . OK , besides cats , dogs , and fish , what are some other pets people keep ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Well , I guess if you are Sigrid and Roy you can keep a tiger or lion . I guess all types of things don't they .
segments.speaker: S2
